org.microbean.jersey.netty

Class HttpContainerResponseWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.microbean.jersey.netty.AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter<HttpRequest>
      • org.microbean.jersey.netty.HttpContainerResponseWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.glassfish.jersey.server.spi.ContainerResponseWriter

    public class HttpContainerResponseWriter
extends AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter<HttpRequest>
    An AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter that works with HttpRequest-typed request objects.
    Author:
    Laird Nelson
    See Also:
    AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter, Http2ContainerResponseWriter

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected ChunkedInput<?> createChunkedInput(EventExecutor eventExecutor, ByteBuf source, long contentLength)
      Returns a new ByteBufChunkedInput when invoked.
      protected boolean needsOutputStream(long contentLength)
      Implements the AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter.needsOutputStream(long) method by returning true if and only if the supplied contentLength is not equal to 0L and if the request method is not HEAD.
      protected void writeAndFlushStatusAndHeaders(org.glassfish.jersey.server.ContainerResponse containerResponse, long contentLength)
      Implements the AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter.writeAndFlushStatusAndHeaders(ContainerResponse, long) method by writing and flushing an HttpResponse object containing a relevant HttpResponseStatus object.
      protected void writeFailureMessage()
      Writes a new DefaultFullHttpResponse message with a Content-Length of 0 and a status equal to HttpResponseStatus.INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR.
      protected void writeLastContentMessage()
      Writes and flushes LastHttpContent.EMPTY_LAST_CONTENT when invoked.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpContainerResponseWriter

        public HttpContainerResponseWriter(HttpRequest httpRequest,
                                   ChannelHandlerContext channelHandlerContext,
                                   Supplier<? extends ScheduledExecutorService> scheduledExecutorServiceSupplier)
        Creates a new HttpContainerResponseWriter.
        Parameters:
        httpRequest - the HttpRequest being responded to; must not be null
        channelHandlerContext - the ChannelHandlerContext representing the current Netty execution; must not be null
        scheduledExecutorServiceSupplier - a Supplier that can supply a ScheduledExecutorService; must not be null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null

    • Method Detail

      • writeAndFlushStatusAndHeaders

        protected final void writeAndFlushStatusAndHeaders(org.glassfish.jersey.server.ContainerResponse containerResponse,
                                                   long contentLength)
        Implements the AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter.writeAndFlushStatusAndHeaders(ContainerResponse, long) method by writing and flushing an HttpResponse object containing a relevant HttpResponseStatus object.
        Specified by:
        writeAndFlushStatusAndHeaders in class AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter<HttpRequest>
        Parameters:
        containerResponse - the ContainerResponse being processed; must not be null
        contentLength - the length of the content in bytes; will be less than 0 if the content length is unknown
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if containerResponse is null

      • needsOutputStream

        protected final boolean needsOutputStream(long contentLength)
        Implements the AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter.needsOutputStream(long) method by returning true if and only if the supplied contentLength is not equal to 0L and if the request method is not HEAD.
        Specified by:
        needsOutputStream in class AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter<HttpRequest>
        Parameters:
        contentLength - the length of the content in bytes; will be less than 0 if the content length is unknown
        Returns:
        true if contentLength is not equal to 0L and if the request method is not HEAD; false in all other cases
        See Also:
        AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter.writeResponseStatusAndHeaders(long, ContainerResponse)

      • createChunkedInput

        protected final ChunkedInput<?> createChunkedInput(EventExecutor eventExecutor,
                                                   ByteBuf source,
                                                   long contentLength)
        Returns a new ByteBufChunkedInput when invoked.
        Specified by:
        createChunkedInput in class AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter<HttpRequest>
        Parameters:
        eventExecutor - an EventExecutor supplied for convenience in case any operations need to be performed on the supplied ByteBuf or on the Netty event loop in general; must not be null
        source - the ByteBuf serving as the source of data; must not be null; must only be read from, not written to
        contentLength - the overall length of the content, in bytes, for which a ChunkedInput is being created; must not be 0; may be less than 0 if the content length is unknown
        Returns:
        a new ByteBufChunkedInput; never null
        See Also:
        AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter.createChunkedInput(EventExecutor, ByteBuf, long), ByteBufChunkedInput.ByteBufChunkedInput(ByteBuf, long), ChunkedInput.readChunk(ByteBufAllocator)

      • writeLastContentMessage

        protected final void writeLastContentMessage()
        Writes and flushes LastHttpContent.EMPTY_LAST_CONTENT when invoked.
        Specified by:
        writeLastContentMessage in class AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter<HttpRequest>
        See Also:
        LastHttpContent, AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter.writeLastContentMessage()

      • writeFailureMessage

        protected final void writeFailureMessage()
        Writes a new DefaultFullHttpResponse message with a Content-Length of 0 and a status equal to HttpResponseStatus.INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR.
        Specified by:
        writeFailureMessage in class AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter<HttpRequest>
